title.value: Milken Institute hosts its first-ever Asia Summit

value:
SINGAPORE – On September 18-19, the Milken Institute will bring together CEOs, major investors, heads of sovereign wealth funds, philanthropists and other leaders from around the world for its first-ever Asia Summit. Like the Institute’s annual Global Conference – but on a much more intimate scale – these leaders will focus on some of the world’s most pressing challenges, but with a strong Asian focus. Panel topics include: prosperity and risk in the Asia-Pacific region, Asia’s new crop of political leaders, and the prognosis for health innovation in Asia.“We are delighted to bring to Asia the Milken Institute’s unique ability to convene leaders, and extend our work addressing the core issues of access to capital, improving health care, and spurring job creation,” said Institute CEO Mike Klowden. “With our new, Singapore-based Asia Center, and in hosting the first of what will be annual Asia Summits, we hope to make a contribution of dynamic ideas to match the region’s economic dynamism.”Held at Singapore’s Four Seasons hotel, the Asia Summit is an invitation-only event, limited to 280 participants who include senior executives in finance and investment as well as top leaders in other key growth industries.Speakers include:David Bonderman, Founding Partner, TPG CapitalChan Heng Chee, Ambassador-at-Large, Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Singapore
Victor Chu, Chairman, First Eastern Investment Group
Tony Fernandes, Group CEO, AirAsia
Thomas Finke, Chairman and CEO, Babson Capital Management LLC
Jamie Forese , Co-President, Citigroup, and CEO of its Institutional Clients Group
James Garner, Head, Unit Development Office, Asia-Pacific Research and Development, Sanofi
Piyush Gupta, CEO and Director, DBS Group; Director, DBS Bank
Joshua Harris, Co-Founder and Chief Investment Officer, Apollo Global Management, LLC
Lim Chow Kiat, Group Chief Investment officer, GIC Private Ltd.
Tommy Koh, Ambassador-At-Large, Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Singapore
Jonathan Nelson, Founder and CEO, Providence Equity Partners
Takeshi Niinami, Advisor, Suntory Holdings Ltd.
Tharman Shanmugaratnam, Deputy Prime Minister and Minister for Finance, Singapore
Jonathan Sokoloff, Managing Partner, Leonard Green & Partners, LP
Axel Weber, Chairman of the Board, UBS AG
Liang Xinjun, Vice Chairman and CEO, Fosun Group
Robert Zoellick, Chairman, International Advisors, Goldman Sachs; Former President, World Bank
Complete information about the Asia Summit, including a full program and a list of speakers confirmed to date, is available at: http://www.milkeninstitute.org/events/conferences/summit/asia-summit-2014/
